sentences: Sinine sobib sulle paremini kui roheline.
Olin väga haige, kuid nüüd tunnen ennast juba paremini.
context: Paremini is the comparative form of the adverb 'parem' (good/well) in Estonian. It means 'better' and is used to compare two things or situations, indicating that one is more favorable, effective, or improved than another. The word often appears with the superlative 'kõige paremini' meaning 'best'. It can modify verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs to show improvement or superior quality.
